sentences.en: But even though they will probably not intentionally veer off course, you should still check periodically.
sentences.cn: 但是,尽管他们不会故意偏离航线, 但是你还是应该时常核对一下是否还在航线上.

sentences.en: Carl wouldn't have had to veer that far to answer nature's call.
sentences.cn: 卡尔解手不需要走这么远的路.

sentences.en: During rush hour, he saw a veer off the road and slam into a fire hydrant.
sentences.cn: 在交通高峰时, 他看到一辆车在马路上转弯,撞到消防栓.

sentences.en: Follow the path and veer left after 400m.
sentences.cn: 沿着这条小路走400米，然后向左转。

sentences.en: He is unlikely to veer from his boss's strongly held views.
sentences.cn: 他不可能背离他老板的强硬立场。

sentences.en: Horrified commuters saw the lorry veer across the motorway and overturn.
sentences.cn: 惊恐万分的通勤者们看见那辆卡车突然冲向高速公路另一侧，接着翻倒在地。

sentences.en: If you fall asleep while driving, you'll probably veer off the road.
sentences.cn: 假如你开车时打瞌睡, 可能会驶离道路.

sentences.en: One side or the other would have to veer away from collision.
sentences.cn: 双方必须有一方改变方向才能避免冲撞.

sentences.en: People whose thinking has become rigid tend to veer with the wind.
sentences.cn: 思想一僵化,随风倒的现象就多起来了.

sentences.en: Then veer right at the forkthe road.
This is how life really happens, and how it gradually, almost unexpectedly veer out of control.
sentences.cn: 它让我们看到了生活的现实, 以及生活如何能够逐渐地 、 让人意想不到地失控.

sentences.en: This philosophical shift parallels the veer to pluralism on a world base.
sentences.cn: 诠释学的哲学转向与世界意义的多元化转向并行.

sentences.en: Veer right and you'll see subway entrance on your right.
sentences.cn: 然后右转,就会看见地铁站入口在你的右边.

sentences.en: Why do nations veer down this path?
sentences.cn: 为什么那些民族会转到这条路上来 呢 ?

sentences.en: Why do nations veer down this path? This was the question Arendt tried to answer.
sentences.cn: 为什么那些民族会转到这条路上来 呢 ?这是阿伦特试图回答的问题.

sentences.en: Worries about exchange rates, he argues, cause central banks to veer off course.
sentences.cn: 他认为, 对于汇率的担忧已经使央行们偏离了正轨.

words.tran_cn: 转变方向；改变观点；顺转（veer的ing形式）
使转向；使顺风；使船尾向上风

trans.tran_en: a change of course or direction

trans.tran_cn: （尤指交通工具）改变方向或路线，（指谈话内容、人的行为或观点）突然改变，（指风）（在北半球按顺时针方向、在南半球按逆时针方向）逐渐转向，风向顺时针转
使改变方向，（从…）突然改变方向，使顺风，（谈话、行为或思想）离开主题（或常轨等）
